com.conversantmedia.mapreduce.tool

Class BaseTool<T extends ToolContext>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configured
      • com.conversantmedia.mapreduce.tool.BaseTool<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ToolListener<T>, org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configurable, org.apache.hadoop.util.Tool
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnnotatedTool

    public abstract class BaseTool<T extends ToolContext>
extends org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configured
implements org.apache.hadoop.util.Tool, ToolListener<T>
    Base tool for use by MapReduce jobs. Subclasses must minimally implement initJob and provide their own main method similar to the following: 
            public static void main(String[] args) {
                int res;
                try {
                        res = ToolRunner.run(new Configuration(), new DeviceIdLoaderTool(), args);
                }
                catch (Exception e) {
                        e.printStackTrace();
                        res = 1;
                }
                System.exit(res);
        }
    Subclasses may optionally override:
    • init - called just prior to initJob
    • cleanUp - called following execution and optional archival step
    • newContext - enables overriding context type
    See Also:
    for base command line options.

      • archiveInputs

        protected void archiveInputs(T context)
                      throws IOException
        Moves our inputs into the 'archive' path for long term storage, or perhaps further processing.
        Parameters:
        context - the job's driver context bean
        Throws:
        IOException - if the inputs cannot be moved to the archive path.

      • cleanUp

        protected void cleanUp(T context)
                throws Exception
        Clean up method is called immediately following 'archiveInputs'. Base implementation does nothing so that subclasses don't have to explicitly implement.
        Parameters:
        context - the job's driver context bean
        Throws:
        Exception - if the operation fails
